organization.description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer (FLC) is the nationwide network of federal laboratories that provides the forum to develop strategies and opportunities for linking laboratory mission technologies and expertise with the marketplace.
organization.title: Federal Laboratory Consortium
organization.name: federal-laboratory-consortium

name: rapid-evaluation-capability-rec
notes: The REC, located at Camp Grayling, MI, uses the only high-explosive impact area in the state to conduct year-round experiments and evaluations. In coordination with the Michigan National Guard, REC uses 147,000 acres to develop and assess technologies and system integrations on platforms before they undergo validation tests.  Capabilities:  &#8226;&#8194; REC provides real-time experiments and evaluates emerging technologies against high-explosive threats, including explosively formed penetrators (EFPs), rocket propelled grenades (RPGs), anti-tank guided missiles (ATGMs), recoilless rifles, mines, direct-fire cannon and mortar, shaped charges and automated fire suppression. REC also verifies medium-caliber armor welds to quickly determine technology maturity. &#8226;&#8194; REC uses remote firing controls, multiple high-speed video camera angles and mobile experiment labs for real-time data/video capture and analysis with large workspaces and collaboration areas.  Benefits:  &#8226;&#8194; Preliminary feasibility assessments are more cost effective than conducting actual tests. &#8226;&#8194; The secluded location provides for discrete evaluation of technology readiness. &#8226;&#8194; A controlled experiment/evaluation setting allows for rapid changes as necessary. &#8226;&#8194; Mobile experiment laboratories facilitate immediate data capture, analysis and collaboration.
title: Rapid Evaluation Capability (REC)
